input_text:
Job Title: Senior Process Engineer

Location: Newark, DE

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Title

Senior Process Engineer

Kbr Company Information

When you become part of the KBR team, your opportunities are endless. As a leading global engineering, construction, and services company, we support the hydrocarbon and government services markets on six continents. Serving our customers through diverse business units, we offer challenging assignments on some of the world's largest and most complex projects where our customers have come to value us, because they know We Deliver.

Join us and you'll be part of a dynamic, elite team of professionals who understand what it takes to get a job done and has the experience, knowledge and determination to succeed.

Senior Process Engineer

Under broad direction, the incumbent interprets, organizes, executes, coordinates assignments, works independently and may lead a small team and interface directly with the client. The incumbent will use skills and experience to perform job responsibilities within a growing Bio-Fuels program. Job role is responsible for a measurable asset, such as assignment project team or budget.

This position will report to leadership located in Newark, DE. The position can be performed as a remote work role. Successful candidates may be required to work from the Newark, DE office on an as needed basis to complete client meetings, project reviews or team trainings.

Responsibilities

Functions as a process lead for multiple small projects or a large project, potentially involving new, unproven technology. Can also serve as a subject matter expert for a particular area.Applies advanced theories, concepts, principles and processes within function or projectOverall responsibility for Process Engineering deliverables, including PFDs, P&IDs, heat and material balances, and process equipment datasheets. Assures Quality Control practices are in place and being followed.Scope definition from receipt of basic data to Issue for Design process deliverables. Interface with client to define operating requirementsLeads other engineers to complete project scope and provide technical guidance to less experienced engineers. On some occasions, will also plan, schedule, and conduct work requiring independent judgment and adaptation of engineering techniques.Defines the process design basis for other disciplines, specifically mechanical, piping, and instrumentation and interface with these groups throughout project completionManages budget and schedule commitments and successfully manages change.

Requirements/Qualifications

B.S. Chemical Engineering, with 20+ years industry experienceExperience in the biofuels or refining industry. Bio feedstock experience a plus.Demonstrated leadership of process design on capital projects, including responsibility for budget, schedule, and change management.Experience with process simulation, PFD & P&ID Development, and equipment sizing.PE Preferred

Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits, which could include a 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

INCLUSION AND DIVERSITY AT KBR

At KBR, we are passionate about our people, sustainability and our Zero Harm culture.

These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to and ongoing journey toward being a more inclusive and diverse company. That commitment is central to our team of teams philosophy and fosters an environment of real collaboration across cultures and locations. Our individual differences and perspectives bring enhanced value to our teams and help us develop solutions for the most challenging problems. We understand that by embracing those differences and working together, we are more innovative, more resilient and safer.

We Deliver â€“ Together. 

KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

R2087133

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.title: Senior Process Engineer
output_json.summary: Under broad direction, the incumbent interprets, organizes, executes, coordinates assignments, works independently and may lead a small team and interface directly with the client.
job_responsibilities: Functions as a process lead for multiple small projects or a large project, potentially involving new, unproven technology.
Can also serve as a subject matter expert for a particular area.
Applies advanced theories, concepts, principles and processes within function or project.
Overall responsibility for Process Engineering deliverables, including PFDs, P&IDs, heat and material balances, and process equipment datasheets.
Assures Quality Control practices are in place and being followed.
Scope definition from receipt of basic data to Issue for Design process deliverables.
Interface with client to define operating requirements.
Leads other engineers to complete project scope and provides technical guidance to less experienced engineers.
On some occasions, will also plan, schedule, and conduct work requiring independent judgment and adaptation of engineering techniques.
Defines the process design basis for other disciplines, specifically mechanical, piping, and instrumentation and interfaces with these groups throughout project completion.
Manages budget and schedule commitments and successfully manages change.
